metadata.title: Smithfield, NC Immigration Lawyers - Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC
metadata.metaDescription: Durham is a vibrant North Carolina city with diverse culture, rich history, and a flourishing community. It’s also known as the “City of Medicine,” with healthcare being a major industry including more than 300 medical and health-related companies and medical practices. It is a wonderful place to live for families, couples, and individuals. If you’re someone who is considering immigrating to the United States to become a legal resident of Durham, or somewhere else, or if you have been injured in an accident that wasn’t your fault, or if you have been accused with a crime, Vasquez Law Firm can help you. We are your top choice for representation! We are dedicated to helping clients reach their ideal resolution, no matter what situation they are in. We have extensive experience in personal injury, worker’s compensation, criminal defense, and family law. You can trust us to stand up for your rights! Call now to schedule a free consultation and allow us to apply our 35+ years of experience to your unique situation.

alumniOf.name:
NY. He served in the U.S. Air Force from 2000-2007. He is a veteran of Operation Enduring Freedom and received the Joint Service Achievement Medal for his work as a Spanish linguist for the Defense Intelligence Agency in 2005. William graduated from Campbell University in 2007 with a degree in computer science. He earned his J.D. in 2011 from the North Carolina Central University School of Law. His practice areas include immigration law and criminal defense cases. He is licensed and in good standing with the State Bar of North Carolina and a member of the American Immigration Lawyer Association (AILA.) He is a proud member of the Charlotte community and provides compassionate counsel for all his clients.

content.heroSection:
Smithfield, NC Immigration Lawyers

Many people from around the world travel to the United States to make their home here and strive for their American dream. We happen to agree with the many people seeking citizenship that our country is a pretty great place to live! However, when it comes to the legal processes behind immigration, it’s common for people to face a lot of red tape and barriers to entry. Legal procedures always seem complex, and trying to navigate them in a country or language that is foreign to you can seem like a nightmare.

Our Smithfield immigration lawyers at Vasquez Law Firm have spent a combined 40 years helping good people make their homes in the United States of America. We want to help you create the life you have dreamed of! Reach out to schedule a free initial consultation and get started!

How Our Smithfield Immigration Lawyers Can Help You 

The Smithfield immigration lawyers of Vasquez Law Firm are well versed in many practice areas related to immigration law. Some of the common immigration aspects we can help with include:

  • Visas: For those who are looking to stay in the U.S., a visa is a necessity. There are different types of visas that function on temporary or permanent bases. Because there are so many visas out there, it can be confusing to choose the right one one and then follow the procedure for getting it. We can help you ensure that your application is the correct one!
  • Green cards: Being granted a green card is often the first step toward naturalization, which is the goal of many people coming to the U.S.! A green card gives you permanent residency status in the U.S. and allows you to do things like work legally and help family members begin their process for immigration. In order to get a green card, you will need sponsorship from a U.S. citizen or permanent resident, so keep that in mind as you start the green card process.
  • Deportation appeals: There are many reasons removal proceedings might begin against a visa or green card holder. Your residency permissions might be expiring or you could be under threat of deportation thanks to criminal activity. If you are being subject to removal proceedings, we can help you potentially appeal the decision or take other measures such as adjusting your status. If you want to leave voluntarily to return at a later date, we can help you with the details.
  • Adjustment of status: Ready to make the jump from visa to green card? We can help you begin the process. 
  • DACA: The Deferred Action For Childhood Arrivals (DACA) Act gives documentation and legal status to people who have been in the U.S. since childhood. DACA gives “Dreamers” the right to work in the U.S. and provides them with necessities like a social security number and I.D. It also protects them from removal proceedings. If you meet the eligibility requirements, you can be covered by DACA.
  • Criminal offenses: If you are convicted of a crime, you can have your visa or green card revoked and potentially be subject to removal proceedings. As “crimmigration” lawyers, we know how to defend your residency here in the U.S. and potentially shield you from legal penalties associated with crimes such as drug charges, DWI, and theft. 
  • Naturalization: If you are ready to become a citizen of the U.S., we can walk you through the process of naturalization, including your application, citizenship tests, and interviews. Ultimately, we want to help you achieve your American dream!

Vasquez Law Firm Can Help You Achieve Your American Dream

With over 40 years of experience helping our clients overcome struggles related to immigration, there are few problems we don’t know how to take on. If you need guidance for your immigration goals, we want to help! Reach out to schedule a free initial consultation and we will start by getting to know you and your immigration goals. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I get a green card if I do not have a visa?

Generally, you will obtain a visa before you are able to get a green card.

What is the age cut off for DACA?

If you were 31 or older on June 15, 2012, you are not eligible for DACA.

Can I face removal proceedings for assault/drugs/DUI?

Yes, which is why it’s important to work with a lawyer experienced in the field of “crimmigration” (like we are!) 

Practice Areas

  • Smithfield, NC Auto Accident Lawyers
  • Smithfield, NC Immigration Lawyers
  • Smithfield, NC Workers’ Comp Lawyers

mainEntity.name: How long does the immigration process take?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration timelines vary greatly depending on your case type. Green card applications can take 8-33 months, while citizenship typically takes 8-12 months. Contact Vasquez Law Firm for a personalized timeline assessment.

mainEntity.name: Do I need an immigration lawyer?

acceptedAnswer.text: While not required, an immigration lawyer significantly improves your chances of success. Immigration law is complex and constantly changing. Our attorneys at Vasquez Law Firm ensure your application is complete and accurate.

mainEntity.name: How much does an immigration lawyer cost in Charlotte?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration attorney fees vary by case complexity. Vasquez Law Firm offers competitive rates and payment plans. Call 1-844-YO-PELEO for a free consultation and fee quote.

## Serving Charlotte and Surrounding Areas
Vasquez Law Firm proudly serves clients throughout Charlotte, Mecklenburg County, and the greater North Carolina area. With offices conveniently located in Charlotte, we're here to help with all your legal needs.


## Why Choose Vasquez Law Firm?
- **Experienced Attorneys**: Over 20 years of combined legal experience
- **Bilingual Services**: We speak English and Spanish
- **Free Consultation**: Call 1-844-YO-PELEO today
- **Proven Results**: Hundreds of satisfied clients
- **24/7 Availability**: We're here when you need us
